text:
Thanks for acting quickly on this <@UA886MF42> :pray:

So I don't know the story behind this update and if it was intentional or not, but it would be great if changes like these had backwards compatibility and/or were announced ahead so that we have a chance to act accordingly and provide feedback for you on how it would affect our work. It's quite frustrating to be taken by surprise like this and having to explain the situation to our clients (which are your customers too).

Just came to my attention that multi-language variations of pages don’t work in the staging part of the tool. This is a huge hole IMHO because we can’t test any of the MultiLanguage features of a domain /theme until launch.
Is this an item that is on *HubSpot’s* radar for fixing. Seems to be a big misstep. *<https://share.impulsecreative.com/eDuw6eZQ|Here’s a screenshot.>* Hoping it’s a bug.
Doesn’t work for “Creating a multi-language variation” or Association a multi-language version.

Yes this is crazy right. I've run into the same thing. Here's a community thread on the matter <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Using-content-staging-to-create-and-test-translated-webpages/idi-p/68183>

Question for you all. While I know reverse proxy on HubSpot CMS Enterprise would for example allow an existing website such as <http://www.example.com|www.example.com> that is NOT hosted on the HubSpot CMS to have a HubSpot managed blog at <http://www.example.com/blog|www.example.com/blog> is the inverse possible to?

So say a customer has a website on HubSpot CMS at <http://www.example.com|www.example.com> but then <http://www.example.com/userguide|www.example.com/userguide> could be powered by another non-HubSpot platform but still appear to be on www?
Unfortunately no. You cannot use HubSpot as a proxy to non-HubSpot sites.
Gotcha thanks for the speedy reply!
you triggered my keyword alert for “reverse proxy” :slightly_smiling_face:
Now I have the feeling that every post is going to have the words “reverse proxy” in it.
I thought it might be something like that getting the mighty Jeff Boulter to respond so quickly LOL
Delete this thread now so that only I know the secret hahaha
Hi Everyone! I sit more on the rev ops side than the dev side, so I’m wondering if there is a channel for noobs like me?

Not sure if I am on the right thread! But I am looking for any HubSpot CMS Pros to build out a site on HS for my client. They have the .psd files. Let me know if interested so i can send you  the design and get some pricing ASAP!
Hi there. I'd be happy to quote you to build out your designs.
Does HubSpot offer hosting? Wanted to make a subsection to my HubSpot site but not use HubSpot ecosystem if that makes sense.
HubSpot cms is the hosting as it were.
